comments.description:
This file contains the Gallium API specification which all drivers must implement.
It contains all enums and functions, including those provided by various other driver vendors.
The extension to which a function or enum belongs is defined in its extension attribute. An example could be GA_ULTZ_extension_name. The vendor which added the extension to the Gallium specification is defined in its vendor attribute. In the case of GA_ULTZ_extension_name, the vendor will just be ULTZ.
Currently, the only vendor is ULTZ, who make the following drivers: - Gallium -> DirectX - Gallium -> Vulkan - Gallium -> OpenGL(ES) - Gallium -> Metal

type.name: GAIntPtr
type.comment: An int pointing to an address in memory.

type.name: GADebugProc
type.comment: A function pointer to a debug callback.

type.name: GABool
type.comment: A boolean - 0 for false, 1 for true.

token.name: GA_NONE
token.doc: The last operation was successful

token.name: GA_INVALID_ENUM_PARAMETER
token.doc: An invalid enumerant was passed to a parameter.

token.name: GA_INVALID_VALUE_PARAMETER
token.doc: An invalid value was passed to a parameter.

token.name: GA_INVALID_OPERATION
token.doc: An unsupported/invalid operation was attempted.

token.name: GA_STACK_OVERFLOW
token.doc: An attempt was made to push a value onto a full stack.

token.name: GA_STACK_UNDERFLOW
token.doc: An attempt was made to pop a value from an empty stack.

token.name: GA_OUT_OF_MEMORY
token.doc: There wasn't enough memory free to execute the command.

token.name: GA_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
token.doc: The driver has not implemented this function.

token.name: GA_UNKNOWN_ERROR
token.doc: An anomalous error occured. This usually indicates a bug in the driver.

token.name: GA_MESSAGE
token.doc: Indicates that the debug message is not for an error, but for additional information the developer might need to be aware of.

token.name: GA_VERBOSE_MESSAGE
token.doc: Indicates that the debug message is not for an error, but for additional information the developer might need to be aware of when debugging.

token.name: GA_WARNING
token.doc: Indicates that the debug message is warning the developer.

token.name: GA_ERROR
token.doc: Indicates that the debug message is for an error.

function.name: GAGetError
function.doc: Gets the result of the previous command.

function.name: GASetDebugCallback
function.doc: Sets a callback that is called when an error, warning, or other message is generated.

function.name: GABeginBatch
function.doc: Prepares a new command batch in which subsequent commands will be captured and stored.

function.name: GAFinishBatch
function.doc: Finishes the command batch, and adds it to the underlying API's queue.

function.name: GADestroyBatch
function.doc: Destroys the current batch, including the commands captured within it.

function.name: GAExecuteBatch
function.doc: Sends the given batch to the underlying API. This function is separate to GAFinishBatch to circumvent any thread restrictions the underlying API might have. For example, this function must only be called on the thread where the OpenGL context is current where the underlying API is OpenGL or OpenGL ES.

token.name: GA_OTHER
token.doc: The API backing Gallium isn't documented as an enum.

token.name: GA_NONE
token.doc: The API directly accesses the GPU via a specialized driver, and not through another API.

token.name: GA_METAL
token.doc: The API is being powered by the Metal API on iOS or macOS.

token.name: GA_DIRECTX
token.doc: The API is being powered by the DirectX API on a Microsoft platform.

token.name: GA_OPENGL
token.doc: The API is being powered by the OpenGL API on a desktop platform.

token.name: GA_OPENGLES
token.doc: The API is being powered by the OpenGL API on an embedded system.

token.name: GA_VULKAN
token.doc: The API is being powered by the Vulkan API.

token.name: GA_GNM
token.doc: The API is being powered by the GNM API on PlayStation 4.

token.name: GA_NVN
token.doc: The API is being powered by the NVN API on Nintendo Switch.
